alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 19 at 8:58PM PST until February 22 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. Snow will impact travel along I-90 and through Snoqualmie Pass. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches is expected along I-90 near Snoqualmie Pass.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
